                                            By 
Elizabeth F. Ralph


                                            By 
Todd S. Purdum


                                            By 
                                                    Rick Wilson


                AP Photo

            By 
Eliza Collins

09/17/15, 07:56 AM EDT
Donald Trump is trying something new: complimenting his fellow Republicans. 
The businessman and 2016 GOP presidential challenger made his rounds on the morning news shows Thursday to tout his performance and compliment (sort of) his competitors.
“I really think that everybody did at least pretty well,” Trump said on MSNBC’s Morning Joe Thursday.
Trump even had praise for his usual foe Jeb Bush, saying the former Florida governor did “very well." The billionaire who often calls Bush “low-energy” said he seemed to have more of it in Wednesday night. 
Trump said of former Hewlett-Packard CEO Carly Fiorina that she “did well…I didn’t see her stand out." Fiorina earned praise for her debate performance Wednesday night.
The real estate mogul said there wasn’t anything specific neurosurgeon Ben Carson said that should prove he’s closing in on him in the polls. But he does like Carson and he liked that he “backed” Trump up on his views on autism. 
On a CNN interview after the debate, Trump praised his party. “We have a lot of talent in the Republican party and I think we’re going to do very well come election day.” 
When asked on MSNBC if there was anything he would do differently about the debate, Trump responded that he thinks he did pretty well. 
“There are some things, maybe it would have been better if the guy didn’t hear my statement in Rolling Stone," he said, referring to comments he made to the magazine criticizing Fiorina’s face. 
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: After debate, Trump praises GOP challengers
